I get a lot of responses to my sales emails saying "i'm working with a freelancer who's 1/4 the price of you, so no thanks".
This is always a shock to me. The fact that they value the creative art of writing so little that they will pay a writer pennies per word to write for them is remarkable.
They are working with human beings, yet they are paying rates that can be compared to a sweatshop. Those aren't the type of people we want to work with anyway.

We help digital marketers increase their ROI through end-to-end customer experience personalization.Hyver harnesses real-time data to allow marketers to personalize the full customer journey, from acquisition, through the website visit, and into re-engagement efforts. It does this by showing targeted, personalized dynamic content on the website and synchronizing visitor actions and segment data with other services in the customer journey in real time.

A boutique technology startup venture firm based in Phoenix, AZ. Starting, building, financing, and scaling innovative technology startups across various industries.Our portfolio includes:- Hyver (hyverlabs.com)- LincUp- Upsy (upsy.co)- Slashpath
Trym is the first insurance experience exclusively tailored to fit small and micro business. We are a 500 Startups company (B18, 2016).Still involved as an advisor and investor.
Aristocracy is a consultancy providing contract technology and media services. In 2017, Aristocracy merged into There Ventures.
Hopscratch merged with Trym, bringing a larger portfolio of resources to entrepreneurs, from business formation to insurance.

summary: I consider myself a master at building market-ready SaaS products from scratch and integrating business/marketing strategy with technology. With experience in a variety of organizations, from startups to Fortune 500, private and public sector, I understand the needs of various markets and how to build products and businesses to support them. I exited my first startup in 2016 - Intrakr, an inventory management SaaS product. Previously, I have experience with various startups, American Express, and the National Security Agency. My "superpower"​ is two-fold:1. Building full SaaS products from nothing2. Translating fluently between "business strategy"​ and "engineering"​I enjoy mentoring and advising growing tech start-ups, traveling, photography, and coaching the sport of Olympic Weightlifting.What I do:- Product Innovation- SaaS- Turning tech products into businesses- Web Strategy Development and Implementation- Web Analytics Strategy, Implementation, and Analysis- Start-up Mentorship and AdvisorySome cool things about me:- 500 startups alumnus (Trym, Batch 18, 2016)- Developed one of the first public apps for Android, featured by Google- I've competed at the national level in the sport of Olympic WeightliftingAKA/Common Misspellings: Kurt Morales, Krik Morales
name: Kirk Morales
title: CEO @ Hyver. SaaS Entrepreneur.
